manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
Support for Redmine issue tracker and project management. Redmine version 2.2.0+ is recommended for best compatibility.

Release Notes

V1.2.1

  • NetBeans 7.3.1 compatibility
  • Minor Bug Fixes

V1.2

  • removed Implementation Dependency for plugin Issue Tracking
  • now loading priorities list (requires Redmine 2.2.0+)
  • updated to redmine-java-api V1.18

V1.1.1

  • Fixed compatibility with NetBeans 7.2 and 7.2.1 incl. all updates (compiled against Issue Tracking module V1.27.2)

V1.1

  • [REDMINENB-20] - Error when trying to open and issue
  • [REDMINENB-10] - Project Members
  • [REDMINENB-18] - Reorder columns Find Issues result grid
  • [REDMINENB-14] - Implement issue filtering by Assignee
  • [REDMINENB-15] - Implement filtering by multiple enumeration values
  • [REDMINENB-23] - Add Issues to the Tasks List
  • [REDMINENB-25] - Html preview of the issue description textile markup
  • [REDMINENB-26] - Show created and updated information
  • [REDMINENB-24] - Fix compatibility issues with NetBeans 7.2
  • [REDMINENB-8] - Show options when viewing issue

    • V1.0.8

    • NetBeans 7.1.2 compatibility

    V1.0.7

    • NetBeans 7.1.1 compatibility
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: com.kenai.redminenb.api > 1.11.0, org.apache.commons.lang > 2.4.0, org.apache.commons.logging > 1.1.0, org.eclipse.mylyn.wikitext > 1.0, org.netbeans.api.annotations.common/1 > 1.14.1, org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.20.2, org.netbeans.modules.autoupdate.services > 1.28.2, org.netbeans.modules.bugtracking = 201306052037, org.netbeans.modules.options.api/1 > 1.18.1, org.openide.awt > 7.39.1, org.openide.dialogs > 7.15.1, org.openide.filesystems > 7.62.1, org.openide.loaders > 7.32.1, org.openide.nodes > 7.16.1, org.openide.util > 8.6.1, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.3.1
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: NetBeans plugin for integration with Redmine

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
https://github.com/taskadapter/redmine-java-api
  • Uses Redmine REST API
  • Does not require any plugins installed to Redmine/Chiliproject server.
  • Runs on any standard Java platform
  • Supports HTTP proxy
  • Supports GZipped responses from servers
See also the redmine-java-api Release Notes
